Title__c: BQA-10384 PROJECT DELIVERY ADDRESS FOR PURCHASE ORDERS
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
This CRIM will override IFS standard behavior by invoking a custom event to fetch the Delivery Address established in the PO Header (Order Details tab) to all the lines in the PO.
Please see the attached spec for more details.
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
This CRIM will override IFS standard behavior by invoking a custom event to fetch the Delivery Address established in the PO Header (Order Details tab) to all the lines in the PO.
Please see the attached spec for more details.

records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
The customer has confirmed on the provided solution. 
Quoted

"Testing solution in PPR was completed and final result is as expected.  I selected a project w/3 different project addresses setup on the “project definition” page for deliveries.  Was able to create a PO, toggle on “Project Address” and pick from the (3) addresses via the drop down menu. Once line items were populated, the project connection action was executed. While it does take a short bit of time for the lines to update with the new delivery address, by the time I connected the activity, then when to release the PO, after authorizing the PO, the line details were correct and the appropriate sales tax was applied to the order as well as the correct delivery address was displayed on the Purchase Order Report. 

This testing was successful and I approve to have CRIM deployed to PROD Environment ASAP. "

Unquoted.

Title__c: Technical Feasibility for CRIM
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: Requirement: User will be attaching documents (PDF etc.) into the Manual Supplier Invoice Page. This can be one or more documents. The same invoices will be selected into the Supplier Payment Proposal Page -> Details page for payment. And user would like
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Requirement: User will be attaching documents (PDF etc.) into the Manual Supplier Invoice Page. This can be one or more documents. The same invoices will be selected into the Supplier Payment Proposal Page -> Details page for payment. And user would like to see the documents attached on the Manual Supplier Invoice page visible through the Supplier Payment Proposal -> Details page as well. When each invoice is selected the attachment should be visible for user to select and view. 

Highly appreciate if you could evaluate the technical feasibility of this requirement. Through a CRIM or even through IFS inherent capability. 

Thanks.

Title__c: C0040  Refinment of SDS distribution
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
You don't often get email from kit.roed@diamondvogel.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

[EXTERNAL EMAIL] DO NOT CLICK links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

See
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
You don't often get email from kit.roed@diamondvogel.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

[EXTERNAL EMAIL] DO NOT CLICK links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

See below for the details of the request to refine customization "C0040" which deals with the emailing of SDS upon customer order. The requester point of contact is Curtis Baker <curtis.baker@diamondvogel.com>,<mailto:curtis.baker@diamondvogel.com>,> also please include Brent Vandermyde <brent.vandermyde@diamondvogel.com><mailto:> for visibility.

The Diamond Vogel FreshService request ID is #SR-38502

Thank you,

Kit Roed
Programmer Analyst
Diamond Vogel

On Fri, Oct 13 1:42 PM , Curtis <curtis.baker@diamondvogel.com> wrote:
The attached documents represent a modification of C0040 that will limit the sending of a Product SDS to Once per Customer, unless an updated SDS is created.
At the time of the CRIM the program did not include this feature and was recognized as an interim step.
The method described on the attached documents serves multiple roles. It will be a Chronological record of which SDS was in use when the customer ordered, which SDS was Sent to which customers and keeps the customer from receiving multiple copies of the same SDS.
It is not mean as prescriptive, any approach providing similar results will be heartily endorsed.
If any further information is needed, please let me know.
Curtis Baker
Corporate EHS Manager
Diamond Vogel


C0040  Refinment of SDS distribution

kit.roed@diamondvogel.com

Title__c: BQA-10391 Zim - Timecards automate for projects
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: There is need to automate the timecard approval process from Zim to Twix with hours for projects. There is one team who log their time on Zim for projects. Currently they are manually entered on Twix. They need to pushed automatically from Zim to Twix to
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
There is need to automate the timecard approval process from Zim to Twix with hours for projects. There is one team who log their time on Zim for projects. Currently they are manually entered on Twix. They need to pushed automatically from Zim to Twix to IFS similar to WorkOrders that Scott’s team does.

Below are the steps that need to accomplished - 

1.. Send project, subproject data to Zim - already in place

2.. Zim need to be modified to accommodate the changes and provide users with the feature to select the required data(activity, resource etc) while logging time

3.. Zim integration code need to be modified to capture all the additional data related to projects during timecard process approval from zim to twix.

4.. Test the entire process of timecard approval from Zim → Twix → IFS ->Dayforce

Title__c: BQA-10482 Billing: Need remit address to be listed on invoice
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: Some customers are rejecting invoices due to our remittance address not being shown on invoices. Can we have this listed somewhere as well as our physical address? The only catch is that SoCal and NorCal offices each have their own Remit addresses so Nor
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Some customers are rejecting invoices due to our remittance address not being shown on invoices. Can we have this listed somewhere as well as our physical address? The only catch is that SoCal and NorCal offices each have their own Remit addresses so NorCal invoices would need to show P.O. Box 515580 Los Angeles CA 90051-4596 and SoCal invoices would need to show P.O. Box 515579 Los Angeles, CA 90051-4595.

Business Requirements Overview

This requires a change to the invoice layout. In the invoice header the address for each site on the invoice are pulling in the address (assuming from the company record). Need to understand the logic of the invoice layout. For example, how is the invoice layout distinguishing which address to use based on the site? If it is using the address from the company than the PO Box addresses for both sites will need to be added with an address type of pay and the invoice layout will use these addresses for the Remit to address.
BMCServiceDesk__incidentResolution__c:
CLOSED

Migration of SoCal to AO Reed removed the necessity for this CRIM

Title__c: BQA-10399 Process gap: Contract jobs being billed prior to JRM and payroll
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
Finance team will create invoices for contract jobs prior to running JRM or payroll for employee time.
Results in inaccurate job cost and inability to pay employee for these hours.

Mitigation is being handled by payroll correction process, which is ti
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Finance team will create invoices for contract jobs prior to running JRM or payroll for employee time.
Results in inaccurate job cost and inability to pay employee for these hours.

Mitigation is being handled by payroll correction process, which is time intensive and results in employee being paid late.

Requirements must be clearly identified and a cross-functional solution determined.
Original Caller: Sarah Rust
Original Incident: INC34100856
